thread.title: Weekend temperatures to plummet, mountain snow possible

author: 台北時報
title: Weekend temperatures to plummet, mountain snow possible
text:
A continental cold air mass is to move south toward Taiwan tomorrow, with temperatures to plummet until Monday daytime, the Central Weather Administration said, advising those in mountainous areas to be alert for ice and snow.
The cold front is expected to be felt from late tomorrow evening to the early hours of Sunday, dropping temperatures as low as 11°C to 17°C for the northern region, 12°C to 21°C for the central region and 14°C to 22°C in the south, it said.
Seasonal northeasterly winds would continue to be felt throughout today, with temperatures cooler than yesterday and dropping steadily across the main island and outlying Kinmen and Lienchiang counties, it said.
Photo courtesy of the Central Weather Administration
Today is to be wetter than yesterday, with the highest chance of rainfall in the north, Taoyuan and Yilan County, it said.
Prolonged rainfall is expected in Keelung, the northern coastal regions and mountainous areas of the capital, with some areas to expect heavy rain today, it said.
Areas of elevation above 3,000m are to expect icy roads this weekend before potential snowfall on Monday, it said.
The cold air mass is to weaken by Monday daytime, bringing warmer temperatures across the country, but the northern and eastern regions should still expect cool conditions and moderate rainfall, it said.
Conditions are to remain dry in the Keelung northern coastal region and central-eastern regions from Monday, but mountainous areas in the west should expect sudden showers, while all other regions are to remain cloudy, it added.
Thirty-five earthquakes have exceeded 5.5 on the Richter scale so far this year, the most in 14 years, the Central Weather Administration (CWA) said on Facebook on Thursday. A large earthquake in Hualien County on April 3 released five times as much the energy as the 921 Earthquake on Sept. 21, 1999, the agency said in its latest earthquake report for this year. Hualien County has had the most national earthquake alerts so far this year at 64, with Yilan County second with 23 and Changhua County third with nine, the agency said. Chinese President Xi Jinping (習近平) is unlikely to attempt an invasion of Taiwan during US president-elect Donald Trump’s time in office, Taiwanese and foreign academics said on Friday. Trump is set to begin his second term early next year. Xi’s ambition to establish China as a “true world power” has intensified over the years, but he would not initiate an invasion of Taiwan “in the near future,” as his top priority is to maintain the regime and his power, not unification, Tokyo Woman’s Christian University distinguished visiting professor and contemporary Chinese politics expert Akio Takahara said. On Tuesday, the army in a statement said it anticipates receiving the first batch of 38 M1A2T Abrams main battle tanks from the US, out of 108 tanks ordered, in the coming weeks.
